nav.div: Minooka Community High School District #111 » About Us » Announcements » Coronavirus Resource Page

span.style: font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial;

br.span: In an effort to keep our families updated on school/community-related matters associated with COVID-19 (coronavirus), MCHS District 111 would like to provide some relevant information pertaining to the current situation. This situation is very fluid and, as we have experienced, can change at a moment's notice.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial;

br.span: We will continue to monitor and follow coronavirus updates and guidance from the CDC, Illinois Department of Public Health, Grundy County Department of Health, and the Illinois State Board of Education. Please find our most recent correspondence to families below, as well as important links to updates, prevention tips, and resources. ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

br.em: “Remote learning is learning that happens outside of the traditional classroom because the student and teacher are separated by distance and/or time. Remote learning can be real-time or flexibility timed, and it may or may not involve technology” (ISBE, 2020).

br.br:
Click here for
MCHS District 111 document on
Remote Learning Days Guidance.

Click here for
E-Learning information for Parents
and Students.

img.title: covid19
img.style: width: 168px; height: 130px; border-width: 1px; border-style: solid; border-color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

br.br:
Click here for the
tentative schedule for the remainder
of the academic school year.

br.span:
Lunches for MCHS free and reduced students will be available for pickup on Mondays and
Wednesdays from 9 am to 11 am, each week, through the end of the academic school year.
The pickup location will be the front of South Campus at the main entrance.

br.br:
District UPDATES:
April 24, 2020
MCHS: Important UPDATE from Dr. Lee and Mr. Zwemke: Click here
April 20, 2020
MCHS: Information on Final Exams, AP Testing, and more: Click here
April 17, 2020
MCHS: Important UPDATE from Dr. Lee and Mr. Zwemke: Click here
April 9, 2020
MCHS: Important UPDATE from Dr. Lee and Mr. Zwemke regarding prom and graduation: Click here
April 9, 2020
Due to the Easter Holiday, lunches for MCHS free and reduced students will be available for pickup on Tuesday (4/14) and Thursday (4/16) from 9 am to 11 am next week. The pickup location will be the front of South Campus at the main entrance. After next week the pickup will return to the original schedule.
April 6, 2020
IDHS: A message from the Illinois Department of Human Services regarding
Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP): Click here
April 3, 2020
MCHS: A message from Dr. Lee and Mr. Zwemke: Click here

MCHS: Important School Closure Information UPDATE: Click here March 27, 2020
MCHS: Important UPDATE from Dr. Lee and Mr. Zwemke: Click here
March 20, 2020

March 20, 2020
MCHS: Important UPDATE from Dr. Lee and Mr. Zwemke: Click here
March 18, 2020
Illinois Department of Public Health: Who Should I Call About COVID-19?
March 18, 2020
UPDATE - Extended pickup available tomorrow: MCHS has extended pickup of Meals and Laptops for tomorrow (Thursday, March 19), while supplies last, in the "front" of MCHS South Campus (9:00AM - 11:00AM) *Meals will be available for all MCHS students while supplies last. *District 111 laptops will be available for students without a home device.
March 18, 2020
Counselors/Social Workers are available through their email.
Click here for Student Services Slideshow
March 17, 2020
Lunch Meals Reminder: Meals will be provided as needed for students on Wednesday, March 18th for pick up between the hours of 9:00AM - 11:00AM. Pick up will be at MCHS South Campus: 26655 W. Eames Street / Channahon, Illinois 60410 in the front of the building. There will be staff available to assist you during the pick up time. Meal packages will consist of meals for a number of days.
March 17, 2020
MCHS District Laptop Reminder: Laptop Availability - MCHS District Laptops will be provided for those students who are in need of a home laptop/device on Wednesday, March 18th for pick up between the hours of 9:00AM - 11:00AM. Pick up will be at MCHS South Campus: 26655 W. Eames Street / Channahon, Illinois 60410 in the front of the building. There will be staff available to assist you during the pick up time. *Parents will be asked to sign a MCHS District Laptop sign-out sheet in order to check out a laptop. Click Here to Download Chromebook Agreement
March 16, 2020
MCHS: E-Learning Information for MCHS Students: Click here
March 16, 2020
MCHS: An Important Message for students from Dr. Lee and Mr. Zwemke: Click here
March 16, 2020
MCHS: COVID-19 Important School Information Update: Click here
